profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:08:18 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical materials, including list of patents; files of museum exhibitions; files of college and university exhibitions; writings by and about Labino; correspondence; clippings; and photographs. The files are arranged alphabetically within five separate categories: museums, colleges and universities, commercial institutions, non-commercial institutions and associations, and miscellaneous organizations.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 937-939 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to Dominick Labino after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Glassmaker, sculptor; Grand Rapids, Ohio. Born 1910. Labino was born in Fairmount City, Pa. and studied at Carnegie Intitute of Technology and Toledo Museum of Art School of Design. He holds two honorary degrees from Bowling Green State University and the University of Toledo. He is a glassblower and sculptor, using a technique of free-hand blowing and hot-glass sculpting. He also works on the development of color and color effects in glass.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1974 by Dominick Labino.
